page.title: 02Farming in Bishop Monkton
page.content: The land slopes gently to the wide and undulating Ure valley. Most of the farmland south of the river is arable with narrow woods following streams flowing northwards into the river. There are 17 farms in the area. The three or four larger ones (300 acres or more) grow cereals,roots (mainly sugar beet and potatoes) and hay and silage.The smaller farms grow some crops for feed but concentrate on milk production,bullocks and sheep. There are two high volume pig-rearing units and one large poultry farm.
